articles.title: Espagnol pour Couples : 25 Phrases Essentielles
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Apprendre l'espagnol en couple cr√©e de merveilleuses opportunit√©s de renforcer votre complicit√© tout en d√©couvrant une nouvelle langue ensemble. Que vous planifiez un voyage romantique en Espagne, souhaitiez communiquer avec des membres de la famille hispanophones, ou simplement partager une nouvelle aventure, ma√Ætriser les phrases essentielles en espagnol vous rapprochera tout en ouvrant les portes d'exp√©riences culturelles enrichissantes.

## Pour commencer : salutations de base et politesse

Toute conversation en espagnol commence par des salutations appropri√©es. Ces phrases fondamentales vous aideront tous les deux √† vous sentir √† l'aise dans n'importe quel environnement hispanophone.

<VocabCard
  word="Hola"
  translation="Bonjour / Salut"
  pronunciation="O-la"
  example="Hola, ¬øc√≥mo est√°s?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Buenos d√≠as"
  translation="Bonjour (le matin)"
  pronunciation="BOU√â-noss DI-ass"
  example="Buenos d√≠as, mi amor."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Buenas noches"
  translation="Bonsoir / Bonne nuit"
  pronunciation="BOU√â-nass NO-tch√©ss"
  example="Buenas noches, que descanses."
/>

### Phrases de courtoisie essentielles

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais | Prononciation |
|----------|----------|---------------|
| Por favor | S'il te pla√Æt / S'il vous pla√Æt | por fa-VOR |
| Gracias | Merci | GRA-siass |
| De nada | De rien | d√© NA-da |
| Disculpe | Excusez-moi | diss-KOUL-p√© |
| Lo siento | Je suis d√©sol√©(e) | lo si√®n-TO |

## Expressions romantiques pour couples

Rien ne rapproche davantage les couples que le partage de mots tendres dans une langue aussi belle que l'espagnol. Ces phrases romantiques ajouteront une √©tincelle √† votre relation tout en vous permettant de pratiquer ensemble.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Te quiero"
  translation="Je t'aime"
  pronunciation="t√© ki√©-RO"
  context="Utilis√© pour exprimer l'amour √† votre partenaire, vos amis ou votre famille"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Mi amor"
  translation="Mon amour"
  pronunciation="mi a-MOR"
  example="¬øC√≥mo est√°s, mi amor?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Cari√±o"
  translation="Ch√©ri(e) / Mon c≈ìur"
  pronunciation="ka-RI-gno"
  example="Ven aqu√≠, cari√±o."
/>

<CultureTip title="Termes affectueux" flag="üá™üá∏">
Les hispanophones utilisent fr√©quemment des termes affectueux, m√™me dans les relations moins intimes. ¬´ Mi vida ¬ª (ma vie), ¬´ coraz√≥n ¬ª (c≈ìur) et ¬´ cielo ¬ª (ciel/paradis) sont des expressions courantes qui montrent l'affection au-del√† des relations amoureuses. Cette tendresse verbale est beaucoup plus r√©pandue qu'en France !
</CultureTip>

### Autres phrases romantiques √† pratiquer

- **Eres hermosa/hermoso** (√â-r√©ss √®r-MO-sa/√®r-MO-so) - Tu es belle/beau
- **Me haces feliz** (m√© A-s√©ss f√©-LISS) - Tu me rends heureux/heureuse
- **Eres mi todo** (√â-r√©ss mi TO-do) - Tu es tout pour moi
- **Te extra√±o** (t√© √®ks-TRA-gno) - Tu me manques

## Essentiels de la conversation quotidienne

Ma√Ætriser les phrases de tous les jours permet aux couples de pratiquer l'espagnol naturellement tout au long de la journ√©e, faisant de l'apprentissage linguistique un mode de vie partag√©.

<VocabCard
  word="¬øC√≥mo est√°s?"
  translation="Comment vas-tu ?"
  pronunciation="KO-mo √®ss-TASS"
  example="Hola mi amor, ¬øc√≥mo est√°s hoy?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Estoy bien"
  translation="Je vais bien"
  pronunciation="√®ss-TOY bi√®n"
  example="Estoy bien, gracias por preguntar."
/>

### Le verbe ¬´ Estar ¬ª (√ätre - √©tats temporaires)

<ConjugationTable
  verb="estar"
  meaning="√™tre (temporaire)"
  conjugations={[
    { "person": "Yo", "word": "estoy", "translation": "Je suis" },
    { "person": "T√∫", "word": "est√°s", "translation": "Tu es" },
    { "person": "√âl/Ella", "word": "est√°", "translation": "Il/Elle est" },
    { "person": "Nosotros", "word": "estamos", "translation": "Nous sommes" }
  ]}
/>

## Phrases de voyage pour couples

Vous planifiez une escapade romantique dans un pays hispanophone ? Ces phrases de voyage essentielles vous aideront √† naviguer dans les a√©roports, h√¥tels et restaurants ensemble, avec confiance.

<VocabCard
  word="¬øD√≥nde est√°?"
  translation="O√π est... ?"
  pronunciation="DON-d√© √®ss-TA"
  example="¬øD√≥nde est√° el hotel?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="¬øCu√°nto cuesta?"
  translation="Combien √ßa co√ªte ?"
  pronunciation="KOUAN-to KOU√âS-ta"
  example="¬øCu√°nto cuesta esta habitaci√≥n?"
/>

### Phrases pour le restaurant

| Espagnol | Fran√ßais | Contexte |
|----------|----------|----------|
| Una mesa para dos | Une table pour deux | Pour r√©server |
| La cuenta, por favor | L'addition, s'il vous pla√Æt | Pour payer |
| ¬øQu√© recomienda? | Qu'est-ce que vous recommandez ? | Pour demander des suggestions |
| Est√° delicioso | C'est d√©licieux | Pour complimenter la cuisine |

<CultureTip title="L'√©tiquette √† table" flag="üá™üá∏">
Dans les pays hispanophones, les repas sont des √©v√©nements sociaux. Le d√Æner commence souvent tard (21h-22h), et il est courant de s'attarder √† table pour discuter. Apprendre des phrases comme ¬´ ¬°Buen provecho! ¬ª (Bon app√©tit !) montre votre sensibilit√© culturelle. C'est assez similaire √† la culture fran√ßaise, mais les horaires sont encore plus tardifs en Espagne !
</CultureTip>

## Phrases pour le shopping et les march√©s

Explorer les march√©s locaux ensemble est une merveilleuse fa√ßon de pratiquer l'espagnol tout en vivant une exp√©rience culturelle authentique.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="¬øHabla franc√©s?"
  translation="Parlez-vous fran√ßais ?"
  pronunciation="A-bla fran-S√âSS"
  context="Utilisez cette phrase quand vous avez besoin d'aide et voulez savoir si la personne parle fran√ßais"
/>

- **¬øTienen...?** (ti√©-N√àN) - Avez-vous... ?
- **Me gusta esto** (m√© GOUS-ta √âSS-to) - J'aime ceci
- **Es muy caro** (√®ss mou√Ø KA-ro) - C'est tr√®s cher
- **¬øHay descuento?** (a√Ø d√©ss-KOUEN-to) - Y a-t-il une r√©duction ?

## Phrases d'urgence et d'aide

Bien que nous esp√©rons que vous n'en aurez jamais besoin, conna√Ætre les phrases d'urgence apporte une tranquillit√© d'esprit lors de vos voyages ensemble.

<VocabCard
  word="Ayuda"
  translation="√Ä l'aide"
  pronunciation="a-YOU-da"
  example="¬°Ayuda, por favor!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="No hablo espa√±ol"
  translation="Je ne parle pas espagnol"
  pronunciation="no A-blo √®ss-pa-GNOL"
  example="Lo siento, no hablo espa√±ol muy bien."
/>

## Conseils de pratique pour couples

### Routines de pratique quotidienne

1. **Salutations matinales** : Commencez chaque journ√©e en vous saluant en espagnol
2. **Espagnol √† table** : Pratiquez les phrases li√©es √† la nourriture pendant les repas
3. **Bilans du soir** : Demandez ¬´ ¬øC√≥mo fue tu d√≠a? ¬ª (Comment s'est pass√©e ta journ√©e ?)
4. **Entra√Ænement aux compliments** : Faites-vous des compliments quotidiens en espagnol

### Activit√©s d'apprentissage ludiques

- **Jeux de r√¥le** : Entra√Ænez-vous aux conversations au restaurant, aux dialogues de shopping
- **Soir√©es espagnoles** : Regardez des films espagnols avec sous-titres
- **Exploration musicale** : Apprenez des chansons d'amour espagnoles ensemble
- **Aventures culinaires** : Suivez des recettes espagnoles et apprenez le vocabulaire de la cuisine

<CultureTip title="Variations r√©gionales" flag="üá™üá∏">
L'espagnol varie significativement entre les pays. ¬´ Te quiero ¬ª est universel pour ¬´ Je t'aime ¬ª, mais ¬´ coger ¬ª signifie ¬´ prendre ¬ª en Espagne alors qu'il a un sens vulgaire en Am√©rique latine. Renseignez-vous sur les expressions sp√©cifiques et les nuances culturelles de votre destination. Ces faux-amis peuvent parfois cr√©er des situations embarrassantes, comme en fran√ßais !
</CultureTip>

## D√©velopper votre confiance ensemble

Apprendre l'espagnol en couple offre une motivation et un soutien int√©gr√©s. Ne vous inqui√©tez pas de faire des erreurs - elles font partie du processus d'apprentissage ! Pratiquez ces phrases essentielles r√©guli√®rement, c√©l√©brez les petites victoires ensemble et rappelez-vous que la r√©gularit√© prime sur la perfection.

Commencez avec cinq phrases par semaine, pratiquez-les quotidiennement et d√©veloppez progressivement votre vocabulaire. Avant m√™me de vous en rendre compte, vous aurez des conversations basiques en espagnol et serez pr√™ts √† explorer les riches cultures des pays hispanophones ensemble.

N'oubliez pas que le voyage d'apprentissage de l'espagnol ensemble cr√©era des souvenirs durables et renforcera votre relation tout en ouvrant les portes de nouvelles exp√©riences culturelles et d'amiti√©s √† travers le monde.

<CTA text="Apprenez l'espagnol en couple avec le Mode √âcoute (d√Æners en famille), votre Love Log personnel, et votre Tuteur qui cr√©e des d√©fis sur mesure." buttonText="Apprendre l'Espagnol en Couple" />

articles.title: Turkish Phrases for Meeting the In-Laws: Make a Great Impression
articles.content:
Meeting your partner's Turkish family is a significant and warm experience. Turkish culture centers around family, and your effort to speak Turkish will immediately earn their respect and affection.

## Why Language Matters

Family (*aile*) is everything in Turkish culture. Speaking their language shows you understand this value and are committed to becoming part of their family.

## First Impressions

### Greetings

**Tanƒ±≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±za √ßok memnun oldum**
*(Ta-nuhsh-tuh-uh-muh-za chok mem-nun ol-dum)*
*I'm very pleased to meet you*

Respectful, warm greeting.

**[Partner's name]'in ailesiyle tanƒ±≈ümak b√ºy√ºk bir onur**
*(..a-i-le-si-yle ta-nuhsh-mak bew-yewk bir o-nur)*
*It's a great honor to meet [partner's name]'s family*

Expresses deep respect.

**[Partner's name] sizden √ßok bahsetti**
*(..siz-den chok bah-set-ti)*
*[Partner's name] has told me so much about you*

## Expressing Gratitude

**Beni evinizde aƒüƒ±rladƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z i√ßin te≈üekk√ºr ederim**
*(Be-ni e-vi-niz-de a-uhr-la-duh-uh-nuhz i-chin te-shek-kewr e-de-rim)*
*Thank you for hosting me in your home*

Acknowledging hospitality.

**√áok lezzetli!**
*(Chok lez-zet-li!)*
*Very delicious!*

Complimenting food‚Äîabsolutely essential.

**Her ≈üey i√ßin √ßok te≈üekk√ºr ederim**
*(Her shey i-chin chok te-shek-kewr e-de-rim)*
*Thank you very much for everything*

## Talking About Your Partner

**Oƒülunuzu/Kƒ±zƒ±nƒ±zƒ± √ßok seviyorum**
*(O-lu-nu-zu/Kuh-zuh-nuh-zuh chok se-vi-yo-rum)*
*I love your son/daughter very much*

Direct declaration of feelings.

**[Partner's name] harika bir insan**
*(..ha-ri-ka bir in-san)*
*[Partner's name] is a wonderful person*

Complimenting how they raised their child.

**M√ºthi≈ü bir evlat yeti≈ütirmi≈üsiniz**
*(Mewt-hish bir ev-lat ye-tish-tir-mish-si-niz)*
*You've raised a wonderful child*

Giving credit to parents‚Äîthey'll love this.

**O beni √ßok mutlu ediyor**
*(O be-ni chok mut-lu e-di-yor)*
*He/She makes me very happy*

## Polite Conversation

**Size yardƒ±mcƒ± olabilir miyim?**
*(Si-ze yar-duhm-juh o-la-bi-lir mi-yim?)*
*May I help you?*

**Bana [topic] hakkƒ±nda daha fazla anlatƒ±r mƒ±sƒ±nƒ±z?**
*(Ba-na..hak-kuhn-da da-ha faz-la an-la-tuhr muh-suh-nuhz?)*
*Could you tell me more about [topic]?*

**√áok g√ºzel bir eviniz var**
*(Chok gew-zel bir e-vi-niz var)*
*You have a very beautiful home*

**Aile benim i√ßin de √ßok √∂nemli**
*(A-i-le be-nim i-chin de chok o-nem-li)*
*Family is also very important to me*

## Saying Goodbye

**Sizinle tanƒ±≈ümak b√ºy√ºk zevkti**
*(Si-zin-le ta-nuhsh-mak bew-yewk zevk-ti)*
*It was a great pleasure to meet you*

**Sizleri yakƒ±nda tekrar g√∂rmeyi umuyorum**
*(Siz-le-ri ya-kuhn-da tek-rar gur-me-yi u-mu-yo-rum)*
*I hope to see you again soon*

## Cultural Tips

- **Hospitality**: Turkish hospitality is legendary‚Äîaccept tea and food graciously
- **Respect elders**: Stand when elders enter, don't sit before they do
- **Remove shoes**: Always at the door
- **Bring gifts**: Sweets, chocolates, or pastries are perfect
- **Hand kissing**: You may be offered an elder's hand to kiss (touch to forehead)
- **Formal address**: Use formal forms with elders; *siz* not *sen*

## Building Relationships

**Sizi kendi ailem gibi g√∂r√ºyorum**
*(Si-zi ken-di a-i-lem gi-bi gu-rew-yo-rum)*
*I see you as my own family*

**Evimizde her zaman misafirsiniz**
*(E-vi-miz-de her za-man mi-sa-fir-si-niz)*
*You are always welcome in our home*

Your effort to speak Turkish shows the respect that Turkish families treasure above all.

articles.title: Guia de Pron√∫ncia Dinamarquesa para Iniciantes: Sons que Conectam Casais
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Come√ßando a aprender dinamarqu√™s com seu amor? A pron√∫ncia pode parecer intimidadora no come√ßo, mas n√£o tema! Com alguns truques simples e pr√°tica juntos, voc√™s dois estar√£o pronunciando palavras dinamarquesas como nativos em pouco tempo. Esta jornada de aprendizado ser√° ainda mais especial quando puderem [expressar seu amor em dinamarqu√™s](/learn/pt/da/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-danish/).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Jeg elsker dig"
  translation="Eu te amo"
  pronunciation="yai EL-ser dai"
  context="A frase mais rom√¢ntica - pratique esta primeiro com seu parceiro!"
/>

## O Segredo dos Sons Dinamarqueses

O dinamarqu√™s tem alguns sons √∫nicos que n√£o existem em portugu√™s. Mas aqui est√° o truque: muitos s√£o varia√ß√µes de sons que voc√™ j√° conhece! Pense na pron√∫ncia como um jogo que voc√™s dois podem jogar juntos.

### Vogais Dinamarquesas: O Cora√ß√£o da Pron√∫ncia

As vogais dinamarquesas s√£o como notas musicais - cada uma tem seu pr√≥prio som especial:

<VocabCard
  word="√Ü"
  translation="Som como 'e' em 'm√™s'"
  pronunciation="eh"
  example="Jeg (yai) - Eu"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√ò"
  translation="Som entre 'u' e 'e'"
  pronunciation="√∂"
  example="K√∏be (K√ñ-beh) - Comprar"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="√Ö"
  translation="Som como 'o' aberto"
  pronunciation="oh"
  example="H√•b (hohb) - Esperan√ßa"
/>

### Consoantes que Conquistam

Algumas consoantes dinamarquesas t√™m personalidade pr√≥pria:

| Letra | Pron√∫ncia | Dica | Exemplo |
|-------|-----------|------|---------|
| **D** | Suave, quase 'th' | Coloque a l√≠ngua nos dentes | **Dejlig** (DAY-lee) - Linda |
| **G** | Suave ap√≥s vogais | Como 'i' em 'pai' | **God** (goh) - Bom |
| **R** | Guttural | Da garganta, como franc√™s | **R√∏d** (r√∂d) - Vermelho |
| **K** | Aspirado | Com ar, como em 'casa' | **Kys** (k√ºs) - Beijo |

## Sons Rom√¢nticos para Casais

Aprenda a pronunciar palavras que voc√™s usar√£o em momentos especiais:

<ConjugationTable
  verb="Elsker"
  meaning="amar"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Eu", polish: "Jeg elsker", english: "Eu amo" },
    { person: "Voc√™", polish: "Du elsker", english: "Voc√™ ama" },
    { person: "Ele/Ela", polish: "Han/Hun elsker", english: "Ele/Ela ama" },
    { person: "N√≥s", polish: "Vi elsker", english: "N√≥s amamos" },
    { person: "Voc√™s", polish: "I elsker", english: "Voc√™s amam" },
    { person: "Eles", polish: "De elsker", english: "Eles amam" }
  ]}
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá∞" title="A M√∫sica do Dinamarqu√™s">
Os dinamarqueses falam com um ritmo musical √∫nico - a entona√ß√£o sobe e desce como uma can√ß√£o. Pratique com seu parceiro: uma pessoa fala, a outra repete imitando o ritmo. √â como dan√ßar com palavras!
</CultureTip>

## Tr√™s Erros que Casais Cometem (e Como Evit√°-los)

### 1. Medo de Parecer Engra√ßado
**Erro:** N√£o praticar por vergonha da pron√∫ncia
**Solu√ß√£o:** Riam juntos dos erros! Os casais que riem juntos permanecem juntos

### 2. Falar Muito R√°pido
**Erro:** Tentar falar no ritmo nativo imediatamente
**Solu√ß√£o:** Comece devagar, como quando [dizem "eu te amo" pela primeira vez](/learn/pt/da/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-danish/)

### 3. N√£o Usar a Entona√ß√£o Correta
**Erro:** Falar plano, sem o "cantar" dinamarqu√™s
**Solu√ß√£o:** Gravem-se pronunciando frases rom√¢nticas e comparem com nativos

## Sons para Momentos Especiais

Pratique estas palavras que voc√™s usar√£o nos momentos mais doces:

| Dinamarqu√™s | Portugu√™s | Pron√∫ncia | Quando Usar |
|-------------|-----------|-----------|-------------|
| **Smuk** | Linda | smook | Ela est√° linda hoje |
| **Dejlig** | Maravilhoso | DAY-lee | Um dia perfeito juntos |
| **K√¶reste** | Querido/amor | K√Ü-res-te | Seu pet name favorito |
| **Knus** | Abra√ßo | knoos | Quando se despedirem |
| **Kys** | Beijo | k√ºs | O beijo boa noite |

<VocabCard
  word="Min k√¶reste"
  translation="Meu amor"
  pronunciation="min K√Ü-res-te"
  example="Min k√¶reste, du er smuk i dag!"
/>

## Exerc√≠cios para Praticar em Casal

### 1. O Jogo do Repetir
Um fala uma palavra, o outro repete. Troquem de pap√©is at√© ambos ficarem confort√°veis.

### 2. Hist√≥rias Rom√¢nticas
Contem pequenas hist√≥rias sobre voc√™s dois usando palavras dinamarquesas. Mesmo que sejam simples!

### 3. Desafio do Beijo
Cada pron√∫ncia perfeita merece um beijo. Aprendizado nunca foi t√£o divertido!

**Frases para praticar agora:**
1. "Du er smuk" (do er smook) - Voc√™ √© linda
2. "Jeg savner dig" (yai SAH-ner dai) - Eu sinto sua falta
3. "Vil du have kaffe?" (vil do hah-veh KAH-feh) - Quer caf√©?
4. "Tak for i dag" (tahk foh ee dai) - Obrigado pelo dia
5. "Godnat, min k√¶reste" (goh-nahd min K√Ü-res-te) - Boa noite, meu amor

<CultureTip flag="üá©üá∞" title="O Segredo Dinamarqu√™s">
Os casais dinamarqueses muitas vezes praticam l√≠nguas juntos - √© considerado uma atividade rom√¢ntica! N√£o tenha medo de errar; o esfor√ßo para falar dinamarqu√™s √© visto como um gesto de amor.
</CultureTip>

## Guia R√°pido de Pron√∫ncia - Salve Este Cart√£o!

```
Vogais Especiais:
√Ü = eh (como em "m√™s")
√ò = √∂ (entre u e e)
√Ö = oh (aberto)

Consoantes Trai√ßoeiras:
D = suave (quase "th")
G = i ap√≥s vogais
R = garganta
K = com ar

Entona√ß√£o:
Sobe e desce como m√∫sica
N√£o √© plano como portugu√™s
```

## Pr√≥ximos Passos na Jornada de Voc√™s

Dominar a pron√∫ncia √© s√≥ o come√ßo! Agora que voc√™s conhecem os sons b√°sicos, que tal explorar mais [vocabul√°rio rom√¢ntico dinamarqu√™s](/learn/pt/da/danish-romantic-phrases-every-occasion/) ou aprender [como pedir um encontro em dinamarqu√™s](/learn/pt/da/danish-date-night-vocabulary/)?

Lembrem-se: cada som que voc√™s dominam juntos √© como uma nota na m√∫sica do seu relacionamento. Com pr√°tica e paci√™ncia, em breve estar√£o conversando em dinamarqu√™s como um casal verdadeiro!

<CTA />

sections: ## Tr√™s Erros que Casais Cometem (e Como Evit√°-los)

articles.title: –ó–Ω–∞–π–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∑ —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω–æ—é –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ —á–µ—Å—å–∫–æ—é: –Ø–∫ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞–π–∫—Ä–∞—â–µ –≤—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–ü–µ—Ä—à–∞ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á –∑ —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω–æ—é –≤–∞—à–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ –∑–∞–≤–∂–¥–∏ —Ö–≤–∏–ª—é—é—á–∞, –æ—Å–æ–±–ª–∏–≤–æ –∫–æ–ª–∏ –º–æ–≤–∞ ‚Äî —á–µ—Å—å–∫–∞! –ù–µ–∑–∞–ª–µ–∂–Ω–æ –≤—ñ–¥ —Ç–æ–≥–æ, —á–∏ —ó–¥–µ—Ç–µ –≤–∏ –¥–æ –ü—Ä–∞–≥–∏ –Ω–∞ –≤–∏—Ö—ñ–¥–Ω—ñ –∞–±–æ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á–∞—î—Ç–µ—Ç–µ—Å—è –∑ –π–æ–≥–æ –±–∞—Ç—å–∫–∞–º–∏ –≤–¥–æ–º–∞, —Ü—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–∂—É—Ç—å –≤–∞–º –ø–æ—á—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è –≤–ø–µ–≤–Ω–µ–Ω–æ —Ç–∞ —Å—Ç–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —Ç–µ–ø–ª–µ –ø–µ—Ä—à–µ –≤—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è. –ê–¥–∂–µ –∫–æ–ª–∏ –≤–∏ –≤—á–∏—Ç–µ –º–æ–≤—É –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞, –∫–æ–∂–Ω–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ —Å—Ç–∞—î –∞–∫—Ç–æ–º –ª—é–±–æ–≤—ñ.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Tƒõ≈°√≠ mƒõ"
  translation="–ü—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è"
  pronunciation="TEH-shee myeh"
  context="–£–Ω—ñ–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø–µ—Ä—à–æ—ó –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—ñ ‚Äî –∑–≤—É—á–∏—Ç—å —Ç–µ–ø–ª–æ —Ç–∞ —â–∏—Ä–æ."
/>

## –ü–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—á—é: –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∏ –µ—Ç–∏–∫–µ—Ç—É

–ß–µ—Å—å–∫–∞ –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–∞ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—î –≤–≤—ñ—á–ª–∏–≤—ñ—Å—Ç—å —Ç–∞ –ø–æ–≤–∞–≥—É –¥–æ —Å—Ç–∞—Ä—à–∏—Ö. –ö–æ–ª–∏ –∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–µ—Å—è –∑ —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω–æ—é –≤–∞—à–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞, –ø–∞–º'—è—Ç–∞–π—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–æ –∫—ñ–ª—å–∫–∞ –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–∏—Ö –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ñ–≤:

<VocabCard
  word="Dobr√Ω den"
  translation="–î–æ–±—Ä–∏–π –¥–µ–Ω—å"
  pronunciation="DOH-bree dehn"
  example="Dobr√Ω den, pan√≠ Nov√°kov√°. Jsem Anna."
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá®üáø" title="–§–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å –º–∞—î –∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–Ω—è">
–í –ß–µ—Ö—ñ—ó –ø—Ä–∏–π–Ω—è—Ç–æ —Å–ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫—É –∑–≤–µ—Ä—Ç–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ –¥–æ –±–∞—Ç—å–∫—ñ–≤ –≤–∞—à–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞. –í–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–π—Ç–µ "pan" (–ø–∞–Ω) –∞–±–æ "pan√≠" (–ø–∞–Ω—ñ) –∑ –ø—Ä—ñ–∑–≤–∏—â–µ–º, –¥–æ–∫–∏ –≤–æ–Ω–∏ —Å–∞–º—ñ –Ω–µ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ–ø–æ–Ω—É—é—Ç—å –ø–µ—Ä–µ–π—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ "—Ç–∏".
</CultureTip>

## –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –¥–ª—è –∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º—Å—Ç–≤–∞

| –ß–µ—Å—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ | –í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞ | –ö–æ–ª–∏ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ |
|--------|------------|--------|---------------------|
| **Jsem [—ñ–º'—è]** | –Ø [—ñ–º'—è] | YEH-sehm | –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—á–∏—Å—å |
| **To je m≈Øj partner/moje partnerka** | –¶–µ –º—ñ–π –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä/–º–æ—è –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∫–∞ | Toh yeh mooy PAHR-tehnr/MOH-yeh pahr-TEHR-kah | –ü—Ä–µ–¥—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—é—á–∏ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ |
| **Jak se m√°te?** | –Ø–∫ —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–∏? | Yahk seh MAH-teh | –§–æ—Ä–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–µ –≤—ñ—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è |
| **Moc se mi tady l√≠b√≠** | –ú–µ–Ω—ñ —Ç—É—Ç –¥—É–∂–µ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è | Mohk seh mee TAH-dee LEE-bee | –í–∏—Å–ª–æ–≤–ª—é—é—á–∏ –∑–∞—Ö–æ–ø–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—è |
| **Dƒõkuji za pozv√°n√≠** | –î—è–∫—É—é –∑–∞ –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è | DYEH-koo-yee zah POHZ-vah-nyee | –ü–æ–¥—è–∫–∞ –∑–∞ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å |

## –ö–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω—ñ —Å—Ü–µ–Ω–∞—Ä—ñ—ó

### –ü—Ä–∏ –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—ñ –±—ñ–ª—è –¥–≤–µ—Ä–µ–π

**–ú–∞–º–∞ –≤–∞—à–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ –≤—ñ–¥–∫—Ä–∏–≤–∞—î –¥–≤–µ—Ä—ñ:**

**–í–æ–Ω–∞:** "Ahoj, ty mus√≠≈° b√Ωt Anna! V√≠tej u n√°s doma."
**–í–∏:** "Dobr√Ω den, pan√≠ Svobodov√°. Ano, to jsem j√°. Dƒõkuji za pozv√°n√≠."

**–í–æ–Ω–∞:** "Pros√≠m tƒõ, ≈ô√≠kej mi Jana. A vezmi si pantofle."
**–í–∏:** "Dƒõkuji, Jano. M√°te kr√°sn√Ω byt."

### –ó–∞ –æ–±—ñ–¥–Ω—ñ–º —Å—Ç–æ–ª–æ–º

–ö–æ–ª–∏ –≤–∞—Å –∑–∞–ø—Ä–æ—à—É—é—Ç—å –¥–æ —Å—Ç–æ–ª—É, –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ –∑–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏:

<VocabCard
  word="Dobrou chu≈•"
  translation="–°–º–∞—á–Ω–æ–≥–æ"
  pronunciation="DOH-broh khoot"
  example="P≈ôed j√≠dlem v≈°ichni ≈ô√≠kaj√≠ 'Dobrou chu≈•!'"
/>

<CultureTip flag="üá®üáø" title="–ß–µ—Å—å–∫—ñ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ—ó –∑–∞ —Å—Ç–æ–ª–æ–º">
–ß–µ—Ö–∏ –∑–∞–∑–≤–∏—á–∞–π –±–∞–∂–∞—é—Ç—å "Dobrou chu≈•" –ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥ —ó–∂–µ—é. –¢–∞–∫–æ–∂ –≤–≤–∞–∂–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è –≤–≤—ñ—á–ª–∏–≤–∏–º –¥–æ—á–µ–∫–∞—Ç–∏—Å—è, –ø–æ–∫–∏ –≤—Å—ñ –æ—Ç—Ä–∏–º–∞—é—Ç—å —ó–∂—É, –ø–µ—Ä—à –Ω—ñ–∂ –ø–æ—á–∏–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ —ó—Å—Ç–∏. –ù–µ –∑–∞–±—É–¥—å—Ç–µ –ø–æ—Ö–≤–∞–ª–∏—Ç–∏ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–≤–∏ ‚Äî —Ü–µ –¥—É–∂–µ —Ü—ñ–Ω—É—î—Ç—å—Å—è!
</CultureTip>

## –¢–µ–º–∏ –¥–ª—è —Ä–æ–∑–º–æ–≤–∏

### –†–æ–∑–ø–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∞—é—á–∏ –ø—Ä–æ —Å–µ–±–µ

| –ß–µ—Å—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ | –í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞ |
|--------|------------|--------|
| **Jsem z Ukrajiny** | –Ø –∑ –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω–∏ | YEH-sehm z oo-KRAH-yee-nee |
| **Pracuji jako [–ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—ñ—è]** | –Ø –ø—Ä–∞—Ü—é—é [–ø—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—ñ—è] | PRAH-tsoo-yee yah-koh |
| **Uƒç√≠m se ƒçesky kv≈Øli [—ñ–º'—è –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞]** | –Ø –≤—á—É —á–µ—Å—å–∫—É —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ [—ñ–º'—è] | OO-cheem seh CHEHS-kee kfoo-lee |
| **M√°m r√°da ƒçesk√© [—â–æ –ø–æ–¥–æ–±–∞—î—Ç—å—Å—è]** | –Ø –ª—é–±–ª—é —á–µ—Å—å–∫–µ [—â–æ] | Mahm RAH-dah CHEHS-keh |

### –ó–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è –¥–æ –Ω–∏—Ö

–ü–æ–∫–∞–∂—ñ—Ç—å –∑–∞—Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å, —Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è—á–∏ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è:

- **Jak dlouho ≈æijete v Praze?** (–Ø–∫ –¥–∞–≤–Ω–æ –≤–∏ –∂–∏–≤–µ—Ç–µ –≤ –ü—Ä–∞–∑—ñ?) - *Yahk DLOH-hoh ZHI-yeh-teh v PRAH-zeh*
- **Kde jste se poznali?** (–î–µ –≤–∏ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏–ª–∏—Å—è?) - *Gdeh ysteh seh POHZ-nah-lee*
- **M√°te je≈°tƒõ dal≈°√≠ dƒõti?** (–£ –≤–∞—Å —î —â–µ –¥—ñ—Ç–∏?) - *Mah-teh YESH-teh DAHL-shee dyeh-tee*

–î—ñ–∑–Ω–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –±—ñ–ª—å—à–µ –ø—Ä–æ [—Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–Ω—ñ —á–µ—Å—å–∫—ñ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Ä](/learn/uk/cs/romantic-czech-phrases-for-couples/), —â–æ–± surprise —Å–≤–æ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞.

## –í–≤—ñ—á–ª–∏–≤—ñ –≤–∏—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏

### –ü–æ–¥—è–∫–∞ —Ç–∞ –∫–æ–º–ø–ª—ñ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∏

| –ß–µ—Å—å–∫–∞ | –£–∫—Ä–∞—ó–Ω—Å—å–∫–∞ | –í–∏–º–æ–≤–∞ | –ö–æ–ª–∏ –≤–∏–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Å—Ç–æ–≤—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ |
|--------|------------|--------|---------------------|
| **Dƒõkuji moc** | –í–µ–ª–∏–∫–µ –¥—è–∫—É—é | DYEH-koo-yee mohk | –ó–∞ –≤—Å–µ |
| **To bylo v√Ωborn√©** | –¶–µ –±—É–ª–æ –¥—É–∂–µ —Å–º–∞—á–Ω–æ | Toh BIH-loh VEE-bor-neh | –ü—Ä–æ —ó–∂—É |
| **M√°te kr√°sn√Ω byt/d≈Øm** | –£ –≤–∞—Å –≥–∞—Ä–Ω–∞ –∫–≤–∞—Ä—Ç–∏—Ä–∞/–¥—ñ–º | Mah-teh KRAH-snee beet/doom | –ö–æ–º–ø–ª—ñ–º–µ–Ω—Ç |
| **Jste moc mil√≠** | –í–∏ –¥—É–∂–µ –º–∏–ª—ñ | Ysteh mohk MEE-lee | –ü—Ä–æ –≥–æ—Å–ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä—ñ–≤ |
| **C√≠t√≠m se tu jako doma** | –Ø –ø–æ—á—É–≤–∞—é—Å—è —Ç—É—Ç —è–∫ –≤–¥–æ–º–∞ | TSEE-teem seh too kah-koh DOH-mah | –ü–æ–¥—è–∫–∞ –∑–∞ –≥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–Ω—ñ—Å—Ç—å |

<VocabCard
  word="Nem√°te za co"
  translation="–ù–µ–º–∞ –∑–∞ —â–æ"
  pronunciation="NEH-mah-teh zah tsoh"
  example="Kdy≈æ nƒõkdo ≈ôekne 'dƒõkuji', odpovƒõƒè je 'Nem√°te za co'"
/>

## –Ø–∫—â–æ —â–æ—Å—å –ø—ñ—à–ª–æ –Ω–µ —Ç–∞–∫

### –ö–æ–ª–∏ –Ω–µ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—î—Ç–µ

- **Promi≈àte, nerozum√≠m** (–í–∏–±–∞—á—Ç–µ, –Ω–µ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—é) - *PROH-meen-teh neh-ROH-zoo-meem*
- **M≈Ø≈æete to zopakovat?** (–ú–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –ø–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏?) - *MOO-zheh-teh toh zoh-pah-koh-vaht*
- **Mluv√≠te anglicky?** (–í–∏ —Ä–æ–∑–º–æ–≤–ª—è—î—Ç–µ –∞–Ω–≥–ª—ñ–π—Å—å–∫–æ—é?) - *MLOO-vee-teh AHN-glee-skee*

### –ö–æ–ª–∏ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞

- **Mohu si nƒõco vz√≠t?** (–ú–æ–∂—É —â–æ—Å—å –≤–∑—è—Ç–∏?) - *MOH-hoo see NYEH-tsoh VZEE-teet*
- **Kde je toaleta?** (–î–µ –≤–±–∏—Ä–∞–ª—å–Ω—è?) - *Gdeh yeh toh-AH-leh-tah*
- **Pot≈ôebuji pomoc** (–ú–µ–Ω—ñ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–∞ –¥–æ–ø–æ–º–æ–≥–∞) - *POH-tzhuh-boo-yee POH-mohts*

–î—ñ–∑–Ω–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –±—ñ–ª—å—à–µ –ø—Ä–æ [–æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–∏ —á–µ—Å—å–∫–æ—ó –≥—Ä–∞–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—á–∞—Ç–∫—ñ–≤—Ü—ñ–≤](/learn/uk/cs/czech-grammar-basics-for-beginners/), —â–æ–± –∫—Ä–∞—â–µ —Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—Ç–∏ —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä—É –º–æ–≤–∏.

## –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—ñ–π–Ω—ñ –ø–æ—Ä–∞–¥–∏

1. **–ü—Ä–∏–Ω–µ—Å—ñ—Ç—å –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä—É–Ω–æ–∫** ‚Äî –Ω–µ–≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–∏–π –±—É–∫–µ—Ç –∫–≤—ñ—Ç—ñ–≤ –¥–ª—è –º–∞–º–∏ –∞–±–æ –∫–æ—Ä–æ–±–∫–∞ —Ü—É–∫–µ—Ä–æ–∫ –±—É–¥–µ –¥–æ—Ä–µ—á–Ω–∏–º –∂–µ—Å—Ç–æ–º
2. **–í—á—ñ—Ç—å –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∏ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–≤** ‚Äî –∑–∞–ø–∏—Ç–∞–π—Ç–µ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω–µ—Ä–∞ –∑–∞–∑–¥–∞–ª–µ–≥—ñ–¥—å, —è–∫—ñ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ–π–Ω—ñ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–≤–∏ –≤–æ–Ω–∏ –ø–æ–¥–∞—é—Ç—å
3. **–ü–æ–∫–∞–∂—ñ—Ç—å —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ–≥—Ä–∞—Ñ—ñ—ó** ‚Äî –ø—Ä–∏–Ω–µ—Å—ñ—Ç—å —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ —Å–≤–æ—î—ó —Å—ñ–º'—ó, —â–æ–± –ø–æ–¥—ñ–ª–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è —Å–≤–æ—î—é –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–æ—é
4. **–ë—É–¥—å—Ç–µ –≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—ñ –¥–æ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω—å –ø—Ä–æ –æ–¥—Ä—É–∂–µ–Ω–Ω—è** ‚Äî —á–µ—Å—å–∫—ñ –±–∞—Ç—å–∫–∏ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ —Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤–ª—è—Ç—å—Å—è –ø–ª–∞–Ω–∞–º–∏ –Ω–∞ –º–∞–π–±—É—Ç–Ω—î
5. **–í—á—ñ—Ç—å —á–µ—Å—å–∫—ñ —Ç–æ—Å—Ç–∏** ‚Äî "Na zdrav√≠" (–Ω–∞ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤'—è) –æ–±–æ–≤'—è–∑–∫–æ–≤–æ —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ –≤ –Ω–∞–≥–æ–¥—ñ
6. **–ù–µ –±—ñ–π—Ç–µ—Å—è –ø–æ–º–∏–ª–æ–∫** ‚Äî –≤–∞—à—ñ –∑—É—Å–∏–ª–ª—è –≤–∏–≤—á–∏—Ç–∏ –º–æ–≤—É –≤–∂–µ –≤—Ä–∞–∑—è—Ç—å —ó—Ö

<CultureTip flag="üá®üáø" title="–ß–µ—Å—å–∫—ñ —Ç–æ—Å—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü—ñ—ó">
–ö–æ–ª–∏ –≤–∞—Å –ø—Ä–∏–≥–æ—â–∞—é—Ç—å –Ω–∞–ø–æ—è–º–∏, –¥–æ—á–µ–∫–∞–π—Ç–µ—Å—è, –ø–æ–∫–∏ —Ö—Ç–æ—Å—å —Å–∫–∞–∂–µ "Na zdrav√≠" (–Ω–∞ –∑–¥–æ—Ä–æ–≤'—è), –ø–µ—Ä—à –Ω—ñ–∂ –ø–∏—Ç–∏. –î–∏–≤—ñ—Ç—å—Å—è –ª—é–¥—è–º –≤ –æ—á—ñ, –∫–æ–ª–∏ clink–µ—Ç–µ –∫–µ–ª–∏—Ö–∞–º–∏ ‚Äî —Ü–µ –∑–Ω–∞–∫ –ø–æ–≤–∞–≥–∏!
</CultureTip>

## –®–≤–∏–¥–∫–∞ –¥–æ–≤—ñ–¥–∫–∞: –¢–æ–ø-10 —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑ –¥–ª—è –∑—É—Å—Ç—Ä—ñ—á—ñ –∑ —Ä–æ–¥–∏–Ω–æ—é

1. **Dobr√Ω den** ‚Äî –î–æ–±—Ä–∏–π –¥–µ–Ω—å
2. **Jsem [—ñ–º'—è]** ‚Äî –Ø [—ñ–º'—è]
3. **Tƒõ≈°√≠ mƒõ** ‚Äî –ü—Ä–∏—î–º–Ω–æ –ø–æ–∑–Ω–∞–π–æ–º–∏—Ç–∏—Å—è
